review: I purchased my fire tv from Amazon so it was already linked to my account when it arrived. I am a senior citizen so my tech knowledge is very limited. lol  I had no problem connecting this up and linking to my wi fi. I actually amazed myself that I could do this; I had the neighbor kid on standby in case I had a problem ; only needed him to show me how to play one of the free games.  I purchased this fire tv because my cable/tv bill had become out of sight financially. This fire tv along with Amazon Prime will give my husband and I many hours of entertainment. As long as you have a good internet connection  I would highly recommend this fire tv.

review: Very good for the money. I also have an Apple TV, and by comparison, the Fire TV is much easier to use. This is mainly due to the remote.  I like the ability to add apps and watch them on TV, but I do think the Apple TV's screen presentation and the lettering is more pleasing to the eye, especially with smaller fonts. I have cut my cable tier down to local stations only and the Fire TV has made life much easier. Here are some of my favorite apps: Frequency, Watchup, Smithsonian Channel, the HISTORY Channel, and SlingTV.Pros: 1. You can download TV apps like ABC and FOX from the Amazon and watch them directly on TV without having to mirror them from your cell phone, tablet or PC.2. The interface is easy to use.3. The remote is very easy to use. The voice search feature actually worked as advertisedCons:1. Many of the fonts on the screen are too small and I found myself having to get out of my seat and walk to the TV to read the information on the screen, something I never had to with Apple TV.2. There needs to be an app folder or some way to organize download apps into categories and minimize screen clutter.In spite of those are two minor issues, I will not deduct a star because it was on sale for $84.00. You get what you pay for and need to be realistic with expectations.
